TopicTitle: So, KSP won the GDC Audience Award

Articles.Content:
The KSP hivemind has done it again.

http://www.polygon.com/2014/3/20/5527642/the-2014-game-developer-choice-awards
So close to innovation! But still, 'tis great!

Game is still in .23,

in time i see greater awards on the horizon....
Seems weird they would give an award to s game that hasn't been officially released

Good to see it's enjoying such popularity

Does anyone know how the news have been received in Mexico?

I think Rowsdower's message conveys that message, even though he isn't technically in Mexico

Game is still in .23,

in time i see greater awards on the horizon....

Implying 0.23 out of 1.00. Right? Riiigt?

Probably the most prestigious of the awards given at the show considering the judges gave Gone Home one. Curious why the panel of judges is never named in these, as if the awards are given out by some infallible and faceless authority.

I think Rowsdower's message conveys that message, even though he isn't technically in Mexico

I was thinking more in terms of the local media.

As I understand it SQUAD hasn't received much attention from them yet.

Seems weird they would give an award to s game that hasn't been officially released

KSP is available to the public and they have to pay for it. These traditionally have been the only 2 criteria of "releasing" software. Therefore, KSP has been released. Given the huge number of games have been "released" very green, sometimes even totally unplayable, I'd also say that KSP is more finished than many "official releases". So on that score, it counts as released, too.

We <3 you, hivemind

We are the Kerb

We will add your explosions and epic failures to our own. Your culture will adapt to be friggin' awesome.

You will be assimilated.

Winning Awards with a game that is still in developement means something absolutely awesome.

Imagine yourself becoming awarded for something you didnt even finish.

Well deserved

And its a lovely hivemind if I may add.

You know, there are communities and communities, especially in gaming. In some you get greeted with "Welcome nub i pwn you, k tnx bye" and in others, well, you can guess.

Been a while since I bumped into such a helpful and positively competitive community.

Somehow KSP voids the formula:

nice person + inet anonymity = complete idiot
